â—£â—¥  New Syllabus Challenge!

A new series of fun little challenges, levelled from 1 to 10 covering all aspects of fundamental parkour.

ðŸŽ¯ Split-foot

Vaulting Challenge - Cat-Pass 5

Demonstrate the ability to do a cat-pass with a split-foot / staggered take-off over a hip-height wall.

One foot must be ahead of the other by at least a foot-length and you will be taking off the front foot last.

Any landing is acceptable, but palms must be flat on the wall with no steepling of fingers.

You can use any run-up or momentum you require.

This is to demonstrate that you can use a more efficient staggered take-off.

No twisting onto one side. This is a bilateral movement where both sides of your body should be doing the same motion at the same time.

-- Rules of Challenge --

Rule 1 description : The height of the wall must be hip-height or greater.
Rule 2 description : Wall must be standard brick-length or less.
Rule 3 description : Both sides must be performed together. No twisting of the body onto one side.
Rule 4 description : Five repetitions.
Rule 5 description : Any landing is acceptable.
Rule 6 description : Staggered / Split-foot takeoff position.
Rule 7 description : The hands should be in a flat position, with the full palm touching. No steepled fingers or thumb tucked behind, raising the palm.
